org.wonderly.log
Class StreamFormatter

java.lang.Object
  java.util.logging.Formatter
      java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter
          org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter

public class StreamFormatter
extends SimpleFormatter

This class provides an Formatter implementation which formats log entries into single lines of text. There are several properties which can be set to alter the output for a more or less brief output format.

PropertyDescription
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.withMethods Include source method names on log records.
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.withClasses Include source class names on log records.
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.brief Don't include Logger instance name.
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.truncateLoggerName If brief is not true, use only first letter of each package component and full last element. net.jini.loader.pref.PreferredClassLoader becomes n.j.l.p.PreferredClassLoader
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.timeFormat format of timestamp in logged records
org.wonderly.log.StreamFormatter.dateFormat format of datestamp in logged records.
All of these properties default to false. Setting them to the value of true, yes or 1 will activate the indicated processing of log records.

Field Detail

brief

protected boolean brief
Whether brief format is active. Value assigned here is always overridden by property processing.

trunc

Whether non-brief format should truncate package names to a single char. Value assigned here is always overridden by property processing.

Constructor Detail

StreamFormatter

public StreamFormatter()
Instantiate an instance of this formatter. This will be invoked by the LogManager or other code which is setting up logging configuration.

StreamFormatter

public StreamFormatter(boolean brief)
Create an instance of StreamFormatter with the initial value for setBrief(boolean).

Parameters:
brief - true to enable brief output with no logger name.

StreamFormatter

public StreamFormatter(boolean brief,
                       boolean truncate)
Create an instance of StreamFormatter with the indicated values for setBrief(boolean) and setTruncateLoggerName(boolean).

Parameters:
brief - true to enable brief output.
truncate - if brief is false, then true to enable truncated logger names.
See Also:
setBrief(boolean)
Method Detail

setTruncateLoggerName

public void setTruncateLoggerName(boolean isTrunc)
Set if truncated logger names should be used. Only if setBrief(boolean) has been set to false will the logger name appear in the output stream.

Parameters:
isTrunc - true to turn on truncated logger names.
See Also:
setBrief(boolean)

setBrief

public void setBrief(boolean isBrief)
Turn on brief logging by removing the name of the logger instance from the output.

Parameters:
isBrief - true to enable brief output without logger names.
See Also:
setTruncateLoggerName(boolean)

setWithMethods

public void setWithMethods(boolean how)
turn on the printing of source method signatures in the logged output.

Parameters:
how - true to enable method signatures.

setWithClasses

public void setWithClasses(boolean how)
Turn on/off the inclusing of classname in the formatted output.

Parameters:
how - true to enable classnames.

Overrides:

Parameters:
rec - The log record to format.

The formatted log record value.
